name: Worker
uniques: Comment [Reliable, replaceable, and remarkably flammable. No empire rose without them — mostly because someone had to hold the shovel.]
Can upgrade to [Skirmisher] <after discovering [Imperial Military Doctrine]>

name: Settler
uniques: Comment [Men, women, and children — good at founding empires, great at dying for them]
Founds a new city <by consuming this unit>
Excess Food converted to Production when under construction

name: Work Boats
uniques: May create improvements on water resources

name: Battering Ram
uniques: Comment [Turns “no entry” into “former entry.” Teamwork highly encouraged.]
[15]% Strength bonus for [Melee] units within [0] tiles <vs cities> <when attacking>

name: Siege Tower
uniques: Comment [A revolutionary invention that made invading cities slightly less suicidal. Offers protection for your battle buddies while they commit structural diplomacy.]
[15]% Strength bonus for [Melee] units within [1] tiles <vs cities> <when attacking>
[10]% Strength bonus for [Melee] units within [1] tiles <vs cities> <when defending>
Only available <in cities with a [Siege Workshop]>

name: Skirmisher
uniques: Comment [Light troops trained to throw things and run away, in that order. The smart ones mastered both arts equally.]

civilopediaText.text: Light troops trained in the noble art of throwing things and running away. Skirmishers excel at harassing enemies, avoiding death, and reminding heavier soldiers why mobility matters. Historians call them “hit-and-run specialists.” The enemy just calls them cowards — usually right before getting another javelin in the face.

name: Thracian Peltast
uniques: Comment [Thracian hit-and-run specialists; throw, stab, vanish, repeat.]

civilopediaText.text: Light skirmishers famed for their speed and deadly precision. The Thracians turned javelin warfare into an art — quick to strike, quicker to disappear. Greek generals called them “irregulars.” Everyone else called them gone.

name: Anatolian Tribesman
uniques: Comment [-Light skirmisher, good at harrassing, have high withdraw chance.]

civilopediaText.text: The Anatolian tribesman trusts no banner. Empires burn, mountains don’t.

name: Illyrian Raider
uniques: Comment [Mercenary skirmisher from the Illyrian coast — fights hard, drinks harder, runs fastest when unpaid.]
Only available <in cities with a [Mercenary Camp]>
Can be purchased with [Gold] [in all cities]

civilopediaText.text: The Illyrians were called pirates by the Greeks, “privateers” by the Romans, and “naval contractors” by themselves. History calls that good marketing.

name: Cilician Pirate
uniques: Comment [Coastal skirmisher — hits hard, runs faster, drowns slower. Great at ranged attacks, terrible at staying for melee consequences.]
Only available <in cities with a [Mercenary Camp]>
Can be purchased with [Gold] [in all cities]

civilopediaText.text: The Cilician pirates made the Mediterranean their playground, striking trade routes and vanishing before anyone could fight back. Fast ships, faster feet, and no sense of shame — the perfect combination for a long criminal career.

name: Archer
uniques: Comment [Light archer, ruins ambushes, morale, and anyone who forgot to bring a shield.]
Only available <in cities with a [Archery Range]>

civilopediaText.text: Archers changed warfare by proving you didn’t need armor to win — just range and fear management. From the ancient steppes to city walls, they fought with distance, discipline, and a deep respect for running away when charged.

name: Slinger
uniques: Comment [Light slinger, good at countering ranged units, because nothing says “primitive” like a rock to the face.]

civilopediaText.text: Ancient commanders loved slingers: they could kill from afar, cost next to nothing, and made archers nervous. That’s what we call “cost-effective terror.

name: Mysian Bowman
uniques: Comment [Elite light archer, good at counter-ambushes, accuracy so good it feels personal.]
Only available <in cities with a [Archery Range]>

civilopediaText.text: The Mysians of Asia Minor gained fame as mercenary archers, hired across the Hellenistic world for their precision and willingness to actually hit what they aimed at. Pergamon turned their local talent into a professional corps — loyal, lethal, and occasionally sober.

name: Mardian Archer
uniques: Comment [Elite light archer, not built for defense, built to make sure you don’t need any.]
Only available <in cities with a [Archery Range]>

civilopediaText.text: The Mardians of Persia served the Arsacid kings as elite archers, famed for their precision and unnerving enthusiasm for lethal accuracy. Lightly armored but heavily motivated, they hit hard and vanished before anyone could argue about it.

name: Forester Warband
uniques: Comment [Light Belgae archer, good at ambushing, bad at staying where you can see them.]
Only available <in cities with a [Archery Range]>

civilopediaText.text: The Belgae’s foresters knew every root and shadow of their homeland. In battle, they used the woods as both shield and trap, striking unseen and retreating before the enemy knew who fired. Rome called them barbarians; the trees called them locals.

name: Balearic Slinger
uniques: Comment [Light slinger unit, known for turning iron and spite into long-range diplomacy.]

civilopediaText.text: The Balearic slingers earned their reputation long before Carthage made it official. Trained from childhood to hurl stones and iron darts with surgical precision, they served across the Mediterranean — loyal to coin, not causes.

name: Rhodian Slinger
uniques: Comment [Rhodian mercenary — precise, portable, and politically unpredictable.]
Only available <in cities with a [Mercenary Camp]>
Can be purchased with [Gold] [in all cities]

name: Cretan Archer
uniques: Comment [Veteran mercenary archer, fast, accurate, and morally flexible.]
Only available <in cities with a [Mercenary Camp]>
Can be purchased with [Gold] [in all cities]
Never appears as a Barbarian unit

name: Mercenary Warband
uniques: Comment [Medium shock infantry, proof that capitalism and violence can coexist beautifully.]
Only available <in cities with a [Mercenary Camp]>
Can be purchased with [Gold] [in all cities]

name: Mercenary Axeman
uniques: Comment [Medium infantry, excellent in jungle warfare; terrible at diplomacy.]
Only available <in cities with a [Mercenary Camp]>
Can be purchased with [Gold] [in all cities]

name: Mercenary Hoplite
uniques: Comment [Mercenary hoplite , defends anything, good at stopping cavalry, as long as you’ve paid first.]
Only available <in cities with a [Mercenary Camp]>
Can be purchased with [Gold] [in all cities]

name: Thureophoros
uniques: Comment [Medium spear infantry, moves fast, fights smart, and bills hourly.]
Only available <in cities with a [Mercenary Camp]>
Can be purchased with [Gold] [in all cities]

name: Mercenary Judean Spearman
uniques: Comment [Mercenary spearmen from Judea, disciplined, determined, dangerously dehydrated.]
Only available <in cities with a [Mercenary Camp]>
Can be purchased with [Gold] [in all cities]
Never appears as a Barbarian unit

name: Thracian Mercenary
uniques: Comment [Medium raider, burns, loots, and occasionally remembers who hired them.]
Only available <in cities with a [Mercenary Camp]>
Can be purchased with [Gold] [in all cities]
Never appears as a Barbarian unit

name: Iberian Mercenary
uniques: Comment [Medium infantry, professionals in fighting, amateurs in restraint.]
Only available <in cities with a [Mercenary Camp]>
Can be purchased with [Gold] [in all cities]

name: Oscan Mercenary
uniques: Only available <in cities with a [Mercenary Camp]>
Can be purchased with [Gold] [in all cities]
Comment [-Medium infantry unit, cheaper to deploys.]

name: Iphicratian Hoplite
uniques: Comment [Medium spear infantry, built for sieges and river fights, not poetry.]

name: Spearman
uniques: Comment [Spearman — ideal for stopping horses, not much else.]
Only available <in cities with a [Muster Field]>

name: Ligurian Warrior
uniques: Comment [Light spear, deadly in ambushes, unimpressed by fair fights.]
Only available <in cities with a [Muster Field]>

name: Hoplite
uniques: Comment [Medium spear infantry, ideal for holding ground and philosophical debates.]

name: Spartan Hoplite
uniques: Comment [Heavy spear infantry, elite training, zero childhood, maximum trauma.]

name: Noble Hoplite
uniques: Comment [-Heavy spear infantry, proof that privilege can, in fact, carry a spear.]

name: Pike Phalanx
uniques: Comment [Medium pike unit, long spears, strong against cavalry, short lifespans under missile fire.]
Only available <with [Enable Pike Phalanx]> <hidden from users>

name: Swordsman
uniques: Comment [-Medium infantry, simple, sharp, and solves most problems violently.]
Unbuildable <in cities with a [Hellenic Barracks]> <hidden from users>
Unbuildable <in cities with a [Gallic Barracks]> <hidden from users>

name: Hyrcanian Axeman
uniques: Comment [Medium infantry, strong attack, limited patience.]

name: Gaesatae
uniques: Comment [Light shock unit, excellent versus swords and spears, allergic to armor.]

name: Thracian Warband
uniques: Comment [Medium infantry, hits hard, moves fast, and hates horses personally.]

name: Falxman
uniques: Comment [Light shock infantry, strong versus swords, weak versus everything pointy from afar]

name: Bastarnae Warrior
uniques: Comment [Light shock infantry, ’Tis but a scratch' made violently literal.]

name: Celtiberian Warband
uniques: Comment [Medium infantry, hits hard, screams louder, dies impressively.]

name: Raider Warband
uniques: Comment [Medium infantry, decent on the front line, excellent behind enemy lines.]
Unbuildable <in cities with a [Gallic Barracks]> <hidden from users>

name: Lusitanian Warband
uniques: Comment [Light shock infantry, quick to raid, quick to die. Use them for the sneak attack, then pray they don’t get caught in the crossfire.]

civilopediaText.text: This is your basic, club-swinging fighter.

name: Legion
uniques: Comment [Heavy infantry, these guys can siege a city and build a highway at the same time. Too bad they’re slower than your grandma’s morning walk.]
Can build [All Road] improvements on tiles

name: Manipular Legion
uniques: Comment [-Heavy infantry, can build roads and steal land. Don’t expect them to win any races, but they’ll gladly take your territory while they're at it]
Can build [All Road] improvements on tiles

name: Limitanei
uniques: Comment [Heavy spear infantry, happily defend their fields and build roads back to Rome—as long as the enemy doesn’t show up on the other side of the empire.]
Only available <in cities with a [Army Barracks]>
Can build [All Road] improvements on tiles

name: Heavy Spearman
uniques: Comment [-Heavy spear infantry, basically a moving wall. Effective against cavalry, but if you ask them to do anything else, you’ll get a ‘No thanks.’]
Only available <with [Enable Heavy Spearman]> <hidden from users>

name: Heavy Swordsman
uniques: Comment [Heavy infantry, a frontliner with a sword and a bad attitude. Great at holding the line, terrible at anything requiring speed or finesse.]
Unbuildable <in cities with a [Hellenic Barracks]> <hidden from users>
Unbuildable <in cities with a [Gallic Barracks]> <hidden from users>
Only available <with [Enable Heavy Swordsman]> <hidden from users>

name: Solduros
uniques: Comment [Elite heavy infantry, top-tier frontliners, if you don’t mind them taking their sweet time. They’ll hold the line and look intimidating doing it]

name: Numidian Mercenary
uniques: Comment [Light mounted skirmisher, Fast, annoying, and best used for running away after causing a little chaos. Don’t expect these guys to fight for long—they’ll be gone before you know it.]
Only available <in cities with a [Mercenary Camp]>
Can be purchased with [Gold] [in all cities]

name: Horseman
uniques: Comment [Light cavalry that’s great for hitting and running—because why fight when you can just annoy people and leave]
Only available <before adopting [Numidian Culture]> <hidden from users>

name: Mercenary Horse Archer
uniques: Comment [Elite mounted archer who'll shoot, run, and cry when the real fight starts. Expensive, but they’ll make those arrows fly before they bail]
Only available <in cities with a [Mercenary Camp]>
Can be purchased with [Gold] [in all cities]

name: Horse Archer
uniques: Comment [Light mounted archer, fast, and completely useless if they ever have to actually fight. They’ll shoot arrows, maybe hit something, then ride off before anyone can say ‘where’d they go?.]
Only available <in cities with a [Nomadic Herd]>

name: Camel Archer
uniques: Comment [Medium mounted archer, perfect for desert battles, as long as you don’t expect them to do anything when they leave the sand. They’ll shoot a few arrows and bail before you can blink.]
Only available <in cities with a [Spice Road]>

name: Chariot Archer
uniques: Comment [Medium ranged chariot, a chariot with a bow—because running around in circles is the best way to fight. Good in the desert, terrible on rough terrain. Expect them to get stuck faster than your last bad decision.]
Only available <with [Enable Chariot Archer]> <hidden from users>
Only available <in cities without a [The Oracle of Amun]> <hidden from users>

name: Libyan Chariot Archer
uniques: Comment [Medium ranged chariot, for when you need a flashy unit that’ll shoot a few arrows, then bail when things get rough. They’ll excel in the desert, but anywhere else? They’ll be stuck faster than your last bad mercenary deal.]
Only available <in cities with a [Mercenary Camp]>
Can be purchased with [Gold] [in all cities]

name: War Chariot
uniques: Comment [-Medium chariot unit, bad at rough terrain, good at desert fighting, have strong attack and medium withdraw chance.]
Only available <with [Enable War Chariot]> <hidden from users>

name: Cyrenean Chariot
uniques: Comment [-Medium chariot unit, bad at rough terrain, good at desert fighting, have strong attack and medium withdraw chance.]

name: Pontic Scythed Chariot
uniques: Comment [-Medium chariot unit, bad at rough terrain, good at desert fighting, have strong attack and medium withdraw chance.]

name: Scythed Chariot
uniques: Comment [-Elite medium chariot unit, bad at rough terrain, good at desert fighting, have strong attack and medium withdraw chance.]
Only available <in cities with a [Mercenary Camp]>
Can be purchased with [Gold] [in all cities]

name: Cavalry
uniques: Comment [-Medium cavalry, they’re like the middle child of your army—too good to be ignored, but not nearly enough to win the spotlight. Use them to pretend you’ve got cavalry.]
Only available <before adopting [Numidian Culture]> <hidden from users>

name: Royal Agema
uniques: Comment [-Elite medium cavalry unit, King's personal guards.]
Only available <with [Enable Royal Agema]> <hidden from users>
Never appears as a Barbarian unit

name: Cataphract
uniques: Comment [Very heavy cavalry, the Roman answer to cavalry: heavier, slower, and less punchy than the eastern versions. Great for crushing infantry, as long as you’re cool with sacrificing an arm and a leg to get them] <after adopting [Latin Culture]>

Comment [Very heavy cavalry,The ‘OG tank’ if tanks were slow, expensive, and required a small fortune in horses, manpower, and iron. Sure, they’ll crush infantry, but they’ll also burn a hole in your budget faster.] <before adopting [Latin Culture]>
Only available <in cities with a [Cavalry Barracks]>
Never appears as a Barbarian unit <hidden from users>

name: Armenian Noble
uniques: Comment [-Heavy shock cavalry, too bad they’re just another expensive way to crush weaklings.]
Only available <in cities with a [Cavalry Barracks]>

name: War Elephant
uniques: Comment [-Medium elephant, a beast that’ll crush anything in its path—except your economy. Hope you’ve got the gold to feed it.]
Never appears as a Barbarian unit
Only available <with [Enable War Elephant]> <hidden from users>

name: Armored Elephant
uniques: Comment [-Heavy elephant unit, armored, and ready to flatten anything that dares stand in its way. Just don’t expect it to help with anything delicate.]
Only available <in cities with a [Army Barracks]>

name: Galley
uniques: Comment [-Light naval melee, cheap and disposable. Perfect for getting your men killed without actually accomplishing much]

name: Pentere
uniques: Never appears as a Barbarian unit

name: Hemiola
uniques: Comment [-Medium naval melee, high withdraw chance]
Only available <in cities without a [Colossus]> <hidden from users>

uniques: Comment [-Mercenary medium naval melee, high withdraw chance]

Can be purchased with [Gold] [in all cities]

uniques: Never appears as a Barbarian unit
